title: Introduction to GitHub
description: Introduces newcomers to using and understanding GitHub. Includes instructions for creating a GitHub account and repository, learning how to commit changes, and turning on GitHub Pages.
author: Olivia Wikle

title: Introduction to the Web and HTML
description: Provides an overview of the fundamental building blocks of websites, HTML. Broken into several parts that can be reviewed separately.
author: Evan Williamson

title: Introduction to Markdown
description: Instroduces newcomers to Markdown, a markup language for adding formatting elements to plain text files.
author: Kate Thornhill

title: Introduction to Data
description: Gives newcomers a surface-level introduction to digital project metadata to configure a static website. Includes an introduction to metadata, an introduction to using and editing spreadsheets in Google Sheets, and instructions on how to download an existing metadata sheet, edit it in Google Sheets, save it as a csv and re-upload it to GitHub.
author: Gabriele Hayden

title: Introduction to Computational Methods
description: Using sample data included in the repository, introduces steps that demonstrate how Jekyll builds a static site and how the Liquid template language is used to manipulate and control the data that populates the site.
author: Devin Becker
